rudaux.assignment module¶

class rudaux.assignment.Assignment(name: str, duedate=None, duetime=None, points=1, manual=False, course=None, status='unassigned')[source]¶

Bases: object

Assignment object for maniuplating assignments.

autograde()[source]¶

Initiate automated grading with nbgrader.

collect()[source]¶

Collect an assignment via the nbgrader API. This essentially copies the notebooks to a new location

course = None¶
feedback()[source]¶

Generate feedback reports for student assignments.

grade()[source]¶

Autograde an assignment via the nbgrader API. This runs nbgrader autograde within a docker container.

rudaux.commands module¶

rudaux.commands.grade(args)[source]¶

Grade an assignment. 1. If we are using a ZFS storage system, snapshot with ZFS. 2. ? Copy to a temporary directory 3. Collect assignments with nbgrader 4. Grade assignments with nbgrader 5. If no manual input, generate forms 6. If no manual input, return forms and submit grades

Parameters:args – Arguments passed in from the command line parser.
rudaux.commands.initialize_course(args)[source]¶

Fully Initialize a course. This involves: 0. Reading your configuration file and ensuring all parameters are valid. 1. Identifying the tool name used for your JupyterHub installation in Canvas. 2. Pulling your student list from Canvas. 3. Syncing Canvas with nbgrader (students & assignments). 4. Assigning all of the assignments listed in your config file. 5. Creating the assignments listed in your config file in Canvas. 6. Schedule automated grading of your assignments.

Parameters:args – Arguments passed in from the command line parser.
rudaux.commands.submit(args)[source]¶

Generate feedback for and submit an assignment.

Parameters:args – Arguments passed in from the command line parser.

rudaux.course module¶

Manage an entire course at once.

Bases: object

Course object for manipulating an entire Canvas/JupyterHub/nbgrader course

Assign assignments for a course

Parameters:
  • assignments (str, List[str]) – The name or names of the assignments you wish to assign.
  • overwrite (bool) – Whether or not you wish to overwrite preexisting directories

Commit changes and push a specific repository to its remote.

Parameters:

  • repo_url (str) – The remote url of the location you’re pushing to.
  • branch (str) – The branch you wish to commit changes to.
  • remote (str) – The remote you with to push changes to.
Returns:

Nothing, side effects performed.
